title: Momentum conservation - moving pendulum and system

content.description:
A pendulum is attached to a frame that is on wheels. The frame is free to move back and forth on a horizontal surface as the pendulum oscillates. The figures show the sphere and the frame at three different times.

Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows when the pendulum is at its maximum leftward displacement.

Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows when the pendulum is instantaneously at its equilibrium position.

Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> shows when the pendulum is at its maximum rightward displacement.
content.question: For which of the following two-object systems, if any, is the total momentum constant?

choices.label: None of these two-object systems have a constant momentum.

content.answer: None of these two-object systems have a constant momentum.
